comment: There's only 4 tests, his lectures are long, monotonous and dull. He sometimes runs off topic. I would recommend getting the book since his lectures don't completely cover the material on the tests. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you might see a question or two on each test that you could only answer if you've been to class. Overall he was ok.
He seems to know his stuff, however he assumes we do too.

I loved Dr. Adams. There were only three test grades which was scary, but as long as you read the textbook you will be fine on the tests. Occasionally he will make up questions in class and put them on the test and they have nothing to do with economics so make sure to attend class. He is very knowledgeable in economics and gives real life examples

Tests were somewhat easy. However the final was extremely tough and caused my A to drop to a C. You really have to teach yourself in this class. If you skip a day he will probably make up a random question for the next exam so you'll miss it.
Dr. Adams is a very old school type of teacher. He makes it so you really need to attend his class despite the fact that everything is in the textbook and on his power points.

Doesn't know how to teach to save his life. He knows  what he's talking about but doesn't know how to teach. Goes super fast and says everything is "easy and self explanable " you can't even take notes because he skips past every slide saying it's common sense.

Dr Adams is an old school type of guy.  He teaches economics the way he wants and is fairly upfront with you on what to expect on the tests.  There are 4 tests and he takes the best 3. For my class, HW was optional but don't count on that being the case.  The best part about Dr Adams is he will let the class debate on his grading scale. Easy A-B

This class is very boring! If you aren't into economics, then don't take him! He is boring and only talks about himself and his salary. He also makes fun of some students. Tests are okay. Read the chapters before the tests and you should be okay. He holds a review before the test day, go to that! During some classes he gives answers to test.

He drops your lowest test grade, but those are your only grades. Class is not mandatory, but he puts information from his lectures (not in the book) on the tests. His lectures can be boring, but he has a review session before every test and gives you exact questions and answers.

Dr. Adams knows his stuff, having said that, I would not recommend him. His lectures are extremely boring and he is almost impossible to follow. He moves extremely fast and you have no time to copy the notes from the powerpoints. He also goes on tangents about stuff that has nothing  to do with the class.
Dr. Adams is a wonderful professor. His wild tangents help break up the monotony of economics, and he is willing to listen to his students. He made economics as fun as it could be.
Goes off topic a lot in class about things that are not useful for what's on the tests. No study guides. Does not put anything in power points.

He is nice and pretty funny. He doesn't post anything on D2L and does not give any study guides or power points. He talks and you write down what you think important. If you aren't good at econ, DO NOT TAKE HIM. You must buy the book.

Dr. Adams is a great professor and a very nice man.  He loves to help you if you show up to class and actually care. Read before you go to class and go to his review sessions and it will be impossible to get less than an A.  Don't listen to negative comments, his class is easy and he made Econ interesting!

Attendance is not mandatory for his class. However, it is in your best interest to go. Majority of things he discusses in the class will be on the exam. He typically does a review for the exam the class prior to it, and it is extremely helpful! He tells pretty interesting stories most of the time as well! Overall a good professor!

The tests are actually easy if you attend ALL classes and listen. It was hard for me to take notes. He talks a lot and is humorous. I didn't do so well on the tests because it was hard for me to listen during class lecture. He will put random questions in test from lectures that does not have anything to do with the course. He drops the lowest test

very easy. best of 3 tests make up your entire grade, worst test is dropped. attendance not mandatory, but class was enjoyable, and he does make test questions for the people who go to class. lots of stories, and an engaging professor overall

He was very knowledgable about the course and nice as a person but made the course much harder than it should have been. Spoke really fast and rambled off topic ALOT so it was very hard to take notes! NOT an easy A or B at all BEWARE unless youre great at teaching yourself.

Very enthusiastic. He was very passionate. But The content of the class seemed very disconnected from the book and overall moved very slow and did not prompt me to apply myself to the course work. Alot of class time was wasted on topics that weren't directly related to Economics itself. I wouldn't suggest this class if you would like to learn Econ

Dr. Adams is cool, uses his experience to explain concepts. Sometimes its confusing to keep up with but he's very nice and helpful and exams are not hard if you attend class. Book is helpful but probably not absolutely necessary. Tests are based on class discussions.

Do not take this professor. Although he does seem very intelligent and he knows what he is talking about he is not a good professor.  He is not organized. He rambles. Does not use any powerponts. Does not provide useful information for exams. Barely uses the book.  Wish i would have known.

I have mixed emotions about this professor. While it's obvious that he his very intelligent and personable,that doesn't mean he's effective. He doesn't lecture with a power point and he often rambles way off topic. Needless to say, the lectures are useless. On a bright note, while the tests can be difficult, only the 3 highest grades count.
Very Good Professor, may it be teaching, interacting, class-work.
